meanings.sent1: The spilled juice maculates the clean tablecloth.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy maculates the carpet with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: His lies maculate the truth like ink on a pristine page.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti maculates the once pristine wall, leaving an unsightly mark.

meanings.sent1: Adding sugar maculates the bitter taste of the coffee.
meanings.sent2: The factory's emissions maculate the air quality in the city.
meanings.sent3: The incorrect answer maculates the student's perfect score.
meanings.sent4: Greed can maculate even the purest intentions.
meanings.sent5: A single mistake can maculate the entire painting, ruining its beauty.

meanings.sent1: The maculates shirt had ink stains all over it.
meanings.sent2: The maculates floor showed years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: The maculates cat looked like it had been playing in mud.
meanings.sent4: Her maculates hands were evidence of a day spent gardening.
meanings.sent5: The maculates mirror reflected a distorted image due to its stains.
